titleStmt.title: Cambridge, Cambridge University Library, MS Add.1115

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

summary.p: 60 folios; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: MS Add.1115; Text: Q 3:10-200, Q 4:1-61; 7 Lines per page; Dimensions: 165 x 115 mm; Script style: kūfī D Va; Estimated date of production: 9th or 10th century AD /3rd or 4th century Hijri.

Abbasid Qur'ān probably written in the third or fourth century A.H. / ninth or tenth century C.E, containing verses 10-200 from Sura Āl ʿImrān (سورة آل عمران) and verses 1-61 from Sura al-Nisāʾ (سورة النساء) . For more information about the manuscript, see the entry in the Digital Library of Cambridge University.

The University of Cambridge acquired the fragment in 1878 from Edward H. Palmer (1840-1882) and E.E. Tyrwhitt Drake. The displayed fragment and other early Qur'an manuscripts (call numbers Add. 1115 - Add. 1150) were acquired by Palmer during a research trip to the Sinai Peninsula (cf. Ansorge 2016).
